DataElement.preferredName: Patient Corticosteroid Use Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient's personal medical history includes administration of corticosteroids.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Corticosteroid Use Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient's personal medical history taking hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).(NCI):Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is on a stable dos
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on a stable dose of corticosteroids greater than 1 month or who has been off of corticosteroids for at least 2 weeks, has approval for enrollment been obtained from the CTEP medical monitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving systemic corticosteroids, is patient on a dose of prednisone 5mg/day or less (or equivalent), and must be on this reduced dose for greater than 1 week prior to treatment start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on physiologic doses of corticosteroids (prednisone equivalent 10mg/day or less) have they been on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: >=4 weeks from last dose of systemic corticosteroids greater than 10 mg/day of Prednisone or equivalent. Patients who are on physiologic doses of corticosteroids (Prednisone equivalent 10 mg/day or less) may participate; however, they must be on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment. Patients who are on low or moderate potency topical corticosteroids may participate if they are on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment. Inhaled corticosteroids are acceptable.  Local injections of corticosteroids are acceptable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on a stable dose of corticosteroid which began less than 4 weeks prior to start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received dexamethasone greater than or equal to 40 mg/day or equivalent of any corticosteroids within 2 weeks of the start of the trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on a stable or decreasing dose of corticosteroids over the last 7 days at the time of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient off corticosteroids, or is on a stable or decreasing dose of less than or equal to 10 mg daily prednisone (or equivalent) for at least 2 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been on a stable dose of corticosteroids for less than 1 week?
